question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Convert::to()] [Base point attack] If get_commitment_base() returns an invalid or weak base point, can the scalar multiplication in mul(self.get_secret_a()) produce predictable public keys that compromise validator security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Convert::to()] [Affine conversion vulnerability] Does the into_affine() conversion after scalar multiplication properly handle edge cases like the identity element, or can this create invalid DealtPubKey instances? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Convert::to()] [Zero secret handling] If get_secret_a() returns zero, does the multiplication produce the identity element leading to a trivial public key that breaks security assumptions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: TryFrom::try_from()] [Deserialization bomb] Can an attacker craft malicious byte sequences that cause bcs::from_bytes to allocate excessive memory or enter infinite loops, crashing validator nodes during parameter loading? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: TryFrom::try_from()] [Error information leak] Does mapping all errors to CryptoMaterialError::DeserializationError hide important security-relevant error details that could help detect attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: TryFrom::try_from()] [No size limit] Is there a maximum byte size enforced on the input, or can an attacker provide gigabyte-sized parameters causing resource exhaustion during deserialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: TryFrom::try_from()] [Version compatibility] Does the BCS deserialization handle version mismatches safely, or can parameters serialized with future versions cause undefined behavior when loaded? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Integer overflow in max_num_chunks_padded] Can an attacker provide max_num_shares and ell values that cause (max_num_shares * num_chunks_per_scalar + 1) to overflow u32/usize, resulting in a tiny next_power_of_two value that breaks range proof setup? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Multiplication overflow] When computing max_num_shares * num_chunks_per_scalar, can this overflow for large validator sets (e.g., 10000 validators), causing incorrect max_num_chunks_padded and breaking range proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [next_power_of_two panic] Can the expression ((max_num_shares * num_chunks_per_scalar + 1).next_power_of_two() - 1) overflow and panic, causing validator initialization to fail and preventing DKG ceremony start? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [unsafe_hash_to_affine vulnerability] Does the use of 'unsafe_hash_to_affine' for G_2 generation properly handle the DST parameter, or can weak hash-to-curve implementation allow attackers to find collisions or create biased points? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [DST constant security] Is the DST value 'APTOS_CHUNKED_ELGAMAL_FIELD_PVSS_DST' unique enough to prevent domain separation attacks where the same hash-to-curve is used in different protocols? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [GroupGenerators default security] Does GroupGenerators::default() provide cryptographically secure generators, or can predictable or weak generators compromise the range proof system? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Range proof setup RNG security] Can an attacker manipulate or predict the RNG passed to dekart_univariate_v2::Proof::setup(), compromising the randomness in range proof parameters and breaking zero-knowledge properties? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Message base extraction] Does extracting G from pp_elgamal.message_base() and converting it to projective properly validate the point, or can invalid ElGamal parameters propagate to table building? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Table build size attack] When calling dlog::table::build with size 1u32 << (ell/2), can extreme ell values (e.g., 64) cause 2^32 entry allocation leading to memory exhaustion and validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [ell parameter bounds] Can an attacker call new() with ell=0 or ell>64, causing division by zero, shift overflows, or creating degenerate parameters that break PVSS operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [max_num_shares=0 attack] What happens if max_num_shares=0 is passed? Does this create invalid range proof parameters with zero capacity that cause panics during transcript generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new()] [Powers computation in initialization] If compute_powers_of_radix() is called twice (in new() and potentially elsewhere), can inconsistent results due to non-deterministic computation cause validator divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Panic on serialization] Does the expect() on bcs::to_bytes panic in production if serialization fails due to memory limits or malformed internal state, causing validator crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Lossy serialization] Since 'table' and 'powers_of_radix' are skipped during serialization, can parameters round-trip through to_bytes/try_from lose important validation information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Size amplification] Can the BCS serialization of large PublicParameters (with big range proof keys) create multi-megabyte outputs that cause network or storage issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Empty AIP_80_PREFIX] Does the empty AIP_80_PREFIX mean this type doesn't follow AIP-80 standards, potentially causing compatibility issues with other Aptos cryptographic primitives? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Default::default()] [Weak test parameters] Does using DEFAULT_ELL_FOR_TESTING=16 in production code (via default()) create weak parameters with only 16-bit chunks that could be exploited for faster discrete log attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/public_parameters.rs] [Function: Default::default()] [max_num_shares=1 vulnerability] Does creating default parameters with max_num_shares=1 make the range proof system trivial and potentially exploitable if accidentally used in production? (Medium)
